verbose_text: Causes of anaemia in alpha thalassemia is summarized in four components : 1) low haemoglobin HbA reduced or absent synthesis of alpha globin, 2) production of two abnormal haemoglobins Hb Bart 's (gamma globin tetramers) and HbH (beta globin tetramers) because of insufficient numbers of alpha globin chain, 3) accumulation of excess unmatched non alpha globin chains within red blood cells leads to Intracorpuscular haemolysis, and 4) Ineffective erythropoiesis.
evidence: HbA reduced or absent synthesis of alpha globin, 2) production of two abnormal haemoglobins Hb Bart's (gamma globin tetramers) and HbH
